TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MsmqMessageProperty extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The MsmqMessageProperty class encapsulates the properties of a message that has been read from a queue.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The MsmqMessageProperty class is obtained from the channel context and is used primarily for error processing. For example, if an application reads a message from the dead-letter queue, the application should examine properties like <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty.DeliveryFailure%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty.DeliveryStatus%2A>. If an application is performing its own poison-message handling, it should examine properties like <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty.AbortCount%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets an <xref:System.Int32> value that indicates the number of times the message participated in the transaction that was aborted, that is, channel attempts - 1.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> value that indicates the number of times that the channel attempted to read this message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used in poison-message handling. For more information about poison-message handling, see [Poison Message Handling](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets a value from the enumeration that indicates why the message failed delivery.
Docs.value: A value from the enumeration that indicates why the message failed delivery. May be .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this property together with <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty.DeliveryStatus%2A> when reading a message from a dead-letter queue to determine why the message failed delivery.

Docs.summary: Gets a value from the enumeration that indicates the delivery status of the message.
Docs.value: A value from the enumeration that indicates the delivery status of the message. May be .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A message may have a delivery status of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus>. A message has a delivery status of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus> unless Message Queuing (MSMQ) can determine that it was not delivered, in which case its delivery status becomes <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus>.
An example of an in-doubt message is a message that has expired. Message Queuing cannot determine whether the message was delivered to the application after it expired.
Use this property together with <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty.DeliveryFailure%2A> when reading a message from a dead-letter queue to determine why the message failed delivery.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty Get(class System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message message) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> whose properties are to be retrieved.
Docs.exception: The value is null or if property collection on the message is null.

Docs.summary: Gets an <xref:System.Int32> value that indicates the number of times the message has moved from the main queue to the subqueue or the other way.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> value that indicates the count of the number of times this message has been moved.

Docs.summary: Gets a <xref:System.String> that contains the string "MsmqMessageProperty".

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.String> that contains the string "MsmqMessageProperty".
